name: Greenwich.HR
desc: Web data on U.S. jobs broken out by company, skills, titles, pay, and more.
full_ticker_coverage: The Greenwich.HR data platform includes 3500 tickers.
full_sector_coverage: Greenwich.HR tracks over 5 million new US jobs each month, across all industries. This includes data on hiring demand, pay levels, access to labor, and key skills requirements for 1.5 million organizations. Private and public companies are included to offer the most complete view available of the marginal labor economy.
pricing_structure: Pricing is based on scope and delivery requirements.
why_us?: A data platform that is powerful enough to find real alpha.
advantages: It's well established that hiring behaviors can correlate to future financial performance in labor-intensive industries. But, our clients also know that in order to extract sufficient insights that can yield alpha, you need to be able to look more deeply than just hiring volumes. That is why we include metrics on pay levels, labor availability, role mapping, skills requirements, and many other factors with every job we track. And, we provide the most complete real-time view of the entire labor market - not just the hiring needs of publicly-traded companies. We don’t outsource our data collection, nor do we limit our operations to data exhaust from some other business. We built our data platform to meet the needs of the most savvy analysts, which is why we combine large scale real-time tracking with complete transparency and AI-fueled normalization. And, we make our data platform simple to access and simple to use. No one else offers this complete package.
use_cases: Predictive labor spend (company-specific and for custom portfolios); Early identification of risk or strategic investment signaled by changes in hiring behaviors; Early indication of changes in marginal labor costs; Evaluating access to critical resources and skills through labor competitiveness; Industry sector economic outlook; Custom portfolio competitive benchmarking; And many more.
